intro: Pseudogynoxys pastazensis, commonly known as the Pastaza gynoxys, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
